meanings.definition: A long-legged shorebird with a slender upturned bill.
meanings.sent1: The avocet gracefully waded in the shallow water.
meanings.sent2: I spotted an avocet by the shore during my nature walk.
meanings.sent3: The avocet seemed to be showing off its elegant bill to the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The avocet's bill was like a delicate paintbrush against the backdrop of the wetlands.
meanings.sent5: With its slender bill and long legs, the avocet stood out among the other birds.

meanings.definition: To act as a sentinel or lookout.
meanings.sent1: The soldier avoceted at the entrance, keeping a watchful eye on the surroundings.
meanings.sent2: I will avocet here while you go ahead and explore the area.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to avocet on the windowsill, guarding the house from any intruders.
meanings.sent4: She avoceted at the top of the hill, scanning the horizon for any signs of danger.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse avoceted over the rocky coast, guiding ships safely through the night.
